melee: +1 keen scimitar +10/+5 (1d6+5/15-20 plus bleed) or slam +9 (1d6+4)
description: This jackal-headed, brightly painted clay statue animates and lurches forward, hefting a wickedly hooked sword.

sections.body: A graven guardian cannot attack any creature that openly wears or displays the holy or unholy symbol of the deity to which the graven guardian is dedicated unless that creature first attacks the graven guardian.
sections.name: Faith Bound

sections.body: A graven guardian that carries its deity's favored weapon treats that weapon as a +1 weapon as long as it is wielded by the guardian. If the weapon is a melee weapon, it gains the keen weapon special ability (even if the weapon is a bludgeoning weapon). If it is a thrown weapon, it gains the returning weapon special ability. If it is a ranged weapon, it gains the seeking weapon special ability, and generates new ammunition with each attack (this ammunition is destroyed whether or not it hits).
sections.name: Magic Weapon

sections.body: Graven guardians are human-sized constructs of clay, stone, wood, or similar materials, crafted and painted to resemble a deity or a deity's favored servants. When not in motion, a graven guardian appears identical to a temple or crypt's statue, but while active, graven guardians look extremely lifelike.

Graven guardians are inexorably tied to a specific deity's faith. While unintelligent and thus lacking any real personality, a graven guardian has the ability to recognize fellow worshipers or minions of its deity and does not treat them as enemies unless they first attack. This recognition does not extend so far as to allow these worshipers (or those cunningly disguised as worshipers) to give a graven guardian new orders. As with all constructs, a graven guardian follows only the orders of its creator.

Each graven guardian gains a special ability from two domains assigned during construction. Save DCs for these abilities are Wisdom-based (DC 14 for most guardians). Caster level for these abilities is equal to the graven guardian's Hit Dice (CL 6th for most graven guardians).
sections.name: Guardian Domains

sections.body: Flight —The graven guardian gains a fly speed equal to its base speed with average maneuverability and a Fly skill of +6 (this includes a +4 racial bonus).
sections.name: Air

sections.body: Beast Ward —Animals must make a Will save before they can attack the graven guardian. Any attack on an animal (but not its allies) by the graven guardian breaks this protection. Once the animal makes this Will save, it need not save again against that particular graven guardian on subsequent attacks.
sections.name: Animal

sections.body: Repair —The graven guardian's fast healing increases to 5.
sections.name: Artifice

sections.body: Chaotic Weapons —The graven guardian's weapon and slam attacks are treated as chaotic-aligned. Its magic weapon deals +1d6 points of damage to lawful targets.
sections.name: Chaos

sections.body: Command —The graven guardian can cast command three times per day as a spell-like ability.
sections.name: Charm

sections.body: Alliance —Adjacent worshipers and graven guardians dedicated to the same god gain a +1 luck bonus on attack rolls, weapon damage rolls, and saves.
sections.name: Community

sections.body: Darkness —The graven guardian can cast darkness two times per day as a spell-like ability.
sections.name: Darkness

sections.body: Bleed —The graven guardian's weapon deals 2 points of bleed damage on a hit.
sections.name: Death

sections.body: Shatter —The graven guardian can cast shatter two times per day as a spell-like ability.
sections.name: Destruction

sections.body: Rocky —The graven guardian's natural armor bonus increases by +2.
sections.name: Earth

sections.body: Evil Weapons —The graven guardian's weapon and slam attacks are treated as evil-aligned. Its magic weapon deals +1d6 points of damage to good targets.
sections.name: Evil

sections.body: Flaming —The graven guardian's weapon gains the flaming property.
sections.name: Fire

sections.body: Glorious —The graven guardian's magic weapon and slam attack deal an additional 1d6 points of damage against undead creatures.
sections.name: Glory

sections.body: Good Weapons —The graven guardian's weapon and slam attacks are treated as good-aligned. Its magic weapon deals +1d6 points of damage to evil targets.
sections.name: Good

sections.body: Recovery —Once per day, when reduced below half hit points, the graven guardian automatically heals 3d10+6 points of damage.
sections.name: Healing

sections.body: Familiarity —The graven guardian gains a +2 bonus on attack rolls again any creature it attacked in the past round.
sections.name: Knowledge

sections.body: Lawful Weapons —The graven guardian's weapons and slam attacks are treated as lawful-aligned. Its magic weapon deals +1d6 points of damage to chaotic targets.
sections.name: Law

sections.body: Unfettered —The graven guardian gains a +4 bonus to its CMD.
sections.name: Liberation

sections.body: Lucky —Once per day, the graven guardian may roll a saving throw twice and take the better of the two results as the actual result.
sections.name: Luck

sections.body: Confusion —The graven guardian can cast confusion once per day as a spell-like ability.
sections.name: Madness

sections.body: Resistant —The graven guardian's SR increases by 5.
sections.name: Magic

sections.body: Honored —The graven guardian gains a +1 bonus on attack rolls and combat maneuver checks.
sections.name: Nobility

sections.body: Entangle —The graven guardian can cast entangle three times per day as a spell-like ability.
sections.name: Plant

sections.body: Protected —The graven guardian gains a +2 bonus on all saves.
sections.name: Protection

sections.body: Rest Eternal —Damage dealt by the graven guardian resists any magical healing. Attempting to use magical healing to cure this damage requires a successful caster level check against the guardian's SR. This ability does not affect natural healing or healing provided by extraordinary abilities.
sections.name: Repose

sections.body: Rune Carved —Runes cover the graven guardian. Whenever the graven guardian takes energy damage or energy damage fails to overcome its SR, for the next round, its attacks deal +1d6 points of damage of that energy type. If more than one type of energy attack occurs in a round, roll randomly to determine what kind of extra energy damage it deals.
sections.name: Rune

sections.body: Powerful —The graven guardian gains Power Attack as a bonus feat.
sections.name: Strength

sections.body: Dazzling —When the graven guardian scores a critical hit with its magic weapon, a bright flash blinds the target for 1d4 rounds (Fortitude save negates).
sections.name: Sun

sections.body: Speedy —The guardian gains Mobility as a bonus feat, and all of its modes of movement increase by +10 feet.
sections.name: Travel

sections.body: Trip —The graven guardian gains the trip ability with its melee weapon and slam attacks.
sections.name: Trickery

sections.body: Enhanced —The enhancement bonus of the graven guardian's weapon increases to +2.
sections.name: War

sections.body: Swimmer —The guardian gains a swim speed equal to its base speed, and a Swim skill of +11.
sections.name: Water

sections.body: Shocking Weapon —The graven guardian's weapon gains the shock special ability.
sections.name: Weather

sections.body: A graven guardian's body must be sculpted from clay, stone, or wood, and adorned with precious stones, rare woods, or metal inlays worth 500 gp. The Hit Dice and size of graven guardians can be increased as though they were golems (Bestiary 158).

Construction.Requirements: Craft Construct, greater magic weapon, haste, imbue with spell ability, make whole, stone shape, creator must be caster level 7th

sections.name: Construction

name: Graven Guardian
